events.message: The customer reported an accident involving their vehicle colliding with a pole on the morning of May 1st.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident based on the details of the reported vehicle collision.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the customer's case and to guide them through the claims process.
The customer received confirmation that their claim had been acknowledged and was under review.
The insurer requested photos of the car damage, police report, and driver’s license to proceed with the assessment.
The customer submitted all requested documents including detailed photos and the official police collision report.
An investigation was initiated to review the evidence and assess liability and damage extent.
The investigation concluded with confirmation that the policy covers the damage described in the accident report.
A settlement offer was communicated to the customer covering vehicle repairs and related expenses.
The customer expressed appreciation for the quick processing and seemed satisfied with the proposed settlement.
The claim was formally approved after customer's acceptance of the settlement terms.
The payment for vehicle repairs was issued to the customer’s account without delay.
The claim file was officially closed after the successful payment issuance and confirmation of repair completion.
The claim documents and records were archived for future reference and auditing purposes.
